question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration.

Please help me implement the following requirement using SVG code: create a rickshaw, which is a three-wheeled vehicle used for transportation in India, also known as a Tuktuk or vehicle.

checklist.title: Is the basic structure of the rickshaw (Tuktuk) properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG code includes the fundamental components of a rickshaw: chassis, three wheels (two at the back, one at the front), passenger compartment, and driver's seat. Deduct 3 points if any major component is missing, 2 points if proportions are unrealistic. Full implementation with correct proportions and structural integrity scores 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the rickshaw's detailed features accurately represented?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the rickshaw includes authentic details like handlebars, roof/canopy, passenger seating area, headlights, and characteristic decoration elements. Score 3 points for basic features, 7 points for moderate detail, and 10 points for comprehensive authentic details including decorative elements typical of Indian rickshaws.

checklist.title: Is the SVG code properly structured with appropriate grouping and organization?
checklist.description: Review if the SVG elements are logically grouped (<g> elements) for different parts of the rickshaw (wheels, body, canopy, etc.). Check if proper naming conventions or comments are used. Score 10 for excellent organization, 5 for basic organization, 0 for unorganized code.

checklist.title: Is perspective and dimensionality handled effectively?
checklist.description: Check whether the rickshaw design effectively conveys a three-dimensional appearance through appropriate shadowing, gradients, or perspective techniques. A flat, simplistic design scores 3 points; basic dimensionality scores 6 points; realistic 3D appearance scores 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code is structurally sound, with proper coordinate systems, viewBox settings, and consistent units. Check if it renders properly across different browsers. Code with strong robustness should handle scaling appropriately without distortion. Give 10 points for excellent robustness, 5 for average, 0 if major rendering issues exist.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the visualization (e.g., 1. Animation of wheels spinning 2. Interactive elements that respond to user input 3. Variable color schemes or styles). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Duplicate SVG elements that serve the same purpose 2. Unnecessary complex paths that could be simplified 3. Excessive detail that impacts rendering performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core representation is obscured by redundant elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review code cleanliness (indentation, consistent naming), optimization (use of symbols for repeated elements, appropriate path commands), and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if element IDs/classes are missing or poorly named; deduct 5 points if the SVG contains unnecessary complexity or inefficient path definitions. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color scheme appropriate for an Indian rickshaw 2) Balanced proportions and visual weight 3) Attention to cultural authenticity in the design. Deduct 3 points for poor color choices, 5 points for disproportionate elements, and 5 points for culturally inaccurate representations. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the final SVG optimized for performance and file size?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG is efficiently implemented: 1) Appropriate use of basic shapes vs. complex paths 2) Elimination of unnecessary decimal precision in coordinates 3) Reuse of elements where possible. Deduct 3 points for each 20% increase in file size over an optimized equivalent, 5 points for unused definitions or attributes, and 5 points for overly complex paths that could be simplified. The full score is 10 points.
